intro: Psychotria palustris, commonly known as swamp psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in swampy or boggy habitats. Psychotria palustris is also notable for its role in traditional medicine and its association with certain ecological systems.
